0630/A0/05/883/002.indicator_name: Availability of the National strategy on the improvement of child and adolescents health
0630/A0/05/883/002.headline: The network of YFHCs has been widened with better designed health services to the needs of adolescents practicing risky behaviour. NGOs were involved in the adjustments of youth friendly health services to ensure they reach the most vulnerable adolescents.

0630/A0/05/883/003.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Existence of age- and sex-disaggregated data on HIV testing and counselling among adolescents 10-19 years and by sex
0630/A0/05/883/003.headline: Belarus eliminates mother to child transmission of HIV. Stigma and discrimination towards MARA and adolescents living with HIV is being addressed
0630/A0/05/883/003.baseline_value: The data is available but not disaggregated

0630/A0/04/001/001.status_value: The National Commission on the Rights of the Child and the Parliament Standing Committee on Human Rights at their joint session took the decision on drafting the concept of a Special Law on Domestic Violence Prevention by March 2015
0630/A0/04/001/001.indicator_name: reported gaps in legislation and policy framework in prevention of domestic violence  juvenile justice  independent monitoring of child rights  child care and family support
0630/A0/04/001/001.baseline_value: current legislation and policy framework do not fully address gaps in prevention of domestic violence  juvenile justice  independent monitoring of child rights  child care and family support (National study on violence against children (2007-2008)  Study on causes of the family crisis (2007-2008)  CRC/C/BLR/3-4  2007  CRC recommendations advanced unedited version  2011)

0630/A0/04/001/001.status_value: MICS4 Report is available for a large audience access on the Belstat web-site an global UNICEF site http://www.childinfo.org/mics.html
0630/A0/04/001/001.indicator_name: National and local authorities use reliable and disaggregated data and high quality analysis for decision-making on social policy  including resource allocation for children and families
0630/A0/04/001/001.baseline_value: No regular use of disaggregated data (CRC/C/BLR/3-4) and CEDAW/C/ BLR/7  annual line ministries' statistical books  insufficient data available on budgeting for children at national and local level

0630/A0/05/881/006.indicator_name: Availability of the updated comprehensive assessment of the scale of violence against children (VAC) in different environments
0630/A0/05/881/006.headline: UNICEF supported the government to assess the prevalence of violence against children (VAC) in different environments to develop a comprehensive national system response to VAC.
0630/A0/05/881/006.baseline_value: The national VAC study report (2008)  MICS-4 (2012) and official statistics of investigated crimes against children  are the main information sources for the Government and UNICEF on VAC

0630/A0/05/881/005.indicator_name: Availability of improved legal provision stipulating the inter-agencies cooperation (including responsibilities and provision of integrated services) on assistance to vulnerable children and families at local level introducing set of indicators and risk assessment criteria
0630/A0/05/881/005.headline: UNICEF supported the Government&#39 s to implement its commitment to keep children out of institutions through revision of legislation  and through involvement of national stakeholders in the identification of priorities for improving formal child care.
0630/A0/05/881/005.baseline_value: Current Regulation #47 of the MoE stipulates an out-dated practice and loose set of criteria to recognise the child being in social danger

0630/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: % of districts where early medical rehabilitation services provided to children U3 with special needs by early intervention cabinets
% of children U 3 including children with special needs covered by pre-school services both in urban and rural areas.
Share of children U3 with disability status  out of  the total number of children born with very low and low birth weight

0630/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: Amended Law "On Health Care" with regard to the adolescent's age of consent
Functioning mechanism to ensure coordination on HIV prevention among MARA
Sanitary Rules stipulate the use of HIV express test for MARA in YFHCs  Strengthened cooperation of NGOs and YFHCs on HIV testing and counselling services provision for MARA
number of HIV tested adolescents  % of adolescents with comprehensive knowledge of HIV transmission
Increase in understanding of decision makers and parents of the necessity to lower the age of adolescent's consent in regard to HIV testing

0630/A0/04/002/002.status_value: 11.1% (49 out of 441 children's policlinics applied youth friendly approach to health services provision)
0630/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: % of health institutions for children applying adolescent's friendly approach
% of youth friendly health centres addressing health issues of at-risk young men and women in cooperation with CSOs
% of secondary schools using peer and life skills based education approaches in HIV prevention education
% of secondary schools using  peer based education approaches for promoting healthy life styles
mortality of children aged 0-17 from external causes
proportion of children receiving palliative care to the total number of children who need it

0630/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: # /share of new cases of children deprived of parental care and placed into family-type care versus into institutions
Legal acts having Child care standards provisions
# of districts/locations with inter-agency mechanism/referral system (Database) to effectively detect and response to child   abuse and neglect cases at local level
# of training materials for in-service support for foster parents are integrated in professional qualification upgrade system and available for specialists
Ratio of children at family-type care to those placed in institutions

0630/A0/04/002/003.status_value: Inter-agencies protocols are approved by local authorities in 3 pilot districts of Brest region
0630/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: % of districts where mechanisms of inter-agency and CSOs cooperation on domestic violence are institutionalized
# of residential care institutions for children deprived of parental care
#/share of districts having no new cases of child placement into an institution

0630/A0/04/002/003.status_value: National concept paper on specialisation of judges in Belarus contains specialized chapter on juvenile judges. Training course curriculum for judges dealing with juvenile cases was developed
0630/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: # of districts having specialized juvenile judges/courts
% of alternative sentences on juvenile cases

0630/A0/04/002/003.status_value: By Sept. 2012 the service is provided in Minsk (2 NGOs  1 GO)  Gomel (2 GOs).
0630/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: % of districts where government agencies or CSOs provide families having disabled children with respite care services

0630/A0/05/884/003.indicator_name: Media coverage of child rights agenda increased
0630/A0/05/884/003.headline: Consistency and persistence of UNICEF visibility and messaging around key children's issues facilitated greater engagement of key stakeholders and broad public around child rights issues  contributed to resource mobilization efforts  and strengthened UNICEF brand in Belarus

0630/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: # of cities having institutionalized mechanism for meaningful youth participation in decision making

0630/A0/04/001/002.status_value: 19.5% (22 cities out of 113 joined CFCI and 6 were granted with CFC Honorable Status)
0630/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: % of cities granted child friendly city status

0630/A0/05/882/004.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years
0630/A0/05/882/004.headline: The International Classification of Functioning  Disability and Health (ICF-CY) has been accepted by the Government. This is a critical step of transition from medical to bio-psycho-social model of understanding disability and planning interventions. The ICF-CY still needs to be integrated into the national system of assistance to CWD.

0630/A0/05/882/003.indicator_name: Availability of ECI standards and regulation
0630/A0/05/882/003.headline: UNICEF assisted MoE and MoH to strengthen professional capacity of specialists and system infrastructure to increase the quality of integrated services to children with disabilities. UNICEF and MoH started measures to strengthen the early identification  early intervention and early rehabilitation of children with disabilities.

0630/A0/05/882/003.indicator_name: Availability of guidelines on ECI for professionals
0630/A0/05/882/003.headline: UNICEF assisted MoE and MoH to strengthen professional capacity of specialists and system infrastructure to increase the quality of integrated services to children with disabilities. UNICEF and MoH started measures to strengthen the early identification  early intervention and early rehabilitation of children with disabilities.

0630/A0/05/882/002.headline: Prompted and assisted by UNICEF  state and non-state partners planned actions to specifically improve the quality of life of an increasingly large proportion of children recognized with disabilities.
